definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: STAY PUT and blow whistle if lost.
sentences.chinese: 如果走失了，原地呆着，吹哨子。

sentences.english: The referee whistled and the game began.
sentences.chinese: 裁判哨子一响，比赛开始了。

sentences.english: The policeman was now blowing his whistle, and that sound brought other constables.
sentences.chinese: 那个警察于是吹哨子，哨音招来了其他警察。

sentences.english: The policeman whistled us to stop .
sentences.chinese: 警察吹哨子令我们停止。

sentences.english: Make sure you have a whistle to signal for help.
sentences.chinese: 确保您有哨子，以便发出求救信号。

sentences.english: A light and whistle are provided to attract attention.
sentences.chinese: 一个照明灯和哨子供你引起注意使用。

sentences.english: The lifejacket whistle in Chief Mate's cabin missing.
sentences.chinese: 大副房间的救生衣哨子丢失。

sentences.english: "Easy, " says Ivan. "You stand in front of a cave and whistle.
sentences.chinese: “简单，”伊凡说，“你站在一个洞前并吹哨子。

sentences.english: The shepherd whistles and sends the dog instructions from a distance.
sentences.chinese: 牧羊人从远处吹哨子，向狗发出指令。

sentences.english: I stood, in front of a cave and whistled, " Sergei replies.
sentences.chinese: 我站在一个洞前并吹哨子，”谢尔盖回答说。

sentences.english: Use a whistle if one is available.
sentences.chinese: 如果可能的话可以用哨子。

sentences.english: He piped  all hands on deck.
sentences.chinese: 他吹哨子召集全体海员到甲板上。

sentences.english: Fans also saw referees starting and officiating matches by blowing on their yellow whistles.
sentences.chinese: 球迷还看到主裁判用他们的黄色哨子主持比赛。

sentences.english: He piped away all the sailors.
sentences.chinese: 他吹哨子解散全体海员。

sentences.english: I blew the whistle of my life poetically.
sentences.chinese: 我把生命的哨子诗意地吹响。

sentences.english: Refereeing for education, no whistle, outside the field.
sentences.chinese: 培养青年裁判，没有哨子，在球场外。

definition: failed/busted/to have not succeeded/to have died/to have parted company/to have chilled (of a relationship)
horn (automobile etc)/loudspeaker/brass wind instrument/trumpet/suona 鎖吶|锁呐[suo3 na4]
Tongluo or Tunglo township in Miaoli county 苗栗縣|苗栗县[Miao2 li4 xian4], northwest Taiwan
echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises
